100.description: The server has received the request headers and the client may proceed with the request body.

101.description: The server agrees to switch to the protocol requested by the client.

102.description: The server has received the request and is processing it, but no response is available yet.

200.description: The request has been successfully completed.

201.description: The request has succeeded and a new resource has been created.

202.description: The request has been accepted but not yet processed.

203.description: The response is not authoritative and may have been obtained from a local or third-party copy.

204.description: The request was successful but there is no content to return.

205.description: The client should reset the view of the document.

206.description: The server is delivering only part of the resource requested.

300.description: There are multiple options available, and the client must choose one.

301.description: The requested resource has been permanently moved to a new URL.

302.description: The resource has been temporarily moved to another URL.

303.description: The client should use a GET request to another URL.

304.description: The resource has not changed since the last request.

305.description: The requested resource must be accessed through a proxy.

307.description: The resource is temporarily located at another URL without changing the HTTP method.

308.description: The resource is permanently located at another URL without changing the HTTP method.

400.description: The request contains incorrect syntax or cannot be processed.

401.description: Authentication is required to access the resource.

402.description: Reserved for future use related to digital payments.

403.description: The server understands the request but refuses to authorize it.

404.description: The server cannot find the requested resource.

405.description: The HTTP method used is not allowed for this resource.

406.description: The server cannot produce a response matching the request's acceptable formats.

407.description: The client must authenticate with the proxy.

408.description: The client took too long to send the request.

409.description: The request conflicts with the current state of the resource.

410.description: The resource is no longer available and will not return.

411.description: The request must specify the content length.

412.description: The server does not meet one or more conditions in the request headers.

413.description: The request payload is too large for the server to process.

414.description: The URL provided is too long to be processed.

415.description: The media type is not supported by the server.

416.description: The requested range cannot be fulfilled.

417.description: The expectation in the request headers cannot be met.

418.description: A humorous code defined in RFC 2324.

422.description: The request is well-formed but cannot be processed.

424.description: The request failed due to a dependency on another failed request.

425.description: The server is unwilling to process a request that might be replayed.

426.description: The client must upgrade to a different protocol.

428.description: The server requires conditions to be included in the request.

429.description: The client has sent too many requests in a short period.

431.description: The request headers are too large for the server to process.

451.description: The requested resource is blocked for legal reasons.

500.description: The server encountered an unexpected condition.

501.description: The server does not recognize or support the requested method.

502.description: The server received an invalid response from an upstream server.

503.description: The server is currently unable to handle the request due to maintenance or overload.

504.description: The server did not receive a timely response from another server.

505.description: The server does not support the HTTP version used in the request.

506.description: A configuration error causes the resource to engage in inappropriate content negotiation.

507.description: The server cannot store the necessary representation to complete the request.

508.description: The server detected an infinite loop while processing the request.

510.description: Additional extensions are required for the request to be fulfilled.

511.description: The client must authenticate to access the network.
